page.title: 09ULLAPOOL-A CHILD'S THOUGHTS.
page.content: Near Ullapool seals swim out in the deep,cold sea trying to catch the salmon which leap about in the water. When the fishermen come home from sea with their catch the seagulls swoop down from the sky and try to gobble them up. On the Summer Isles in Loch Broom the black and white kittiwakes fly around in the sky and nest on the high cliffs. On small islands seals bask in the sun on rocks. Grey rabbits hop in and out of their burrows and scuttle about in the long grass. In the seas around these islands are porpoises,dolphins,basking sharks, killer and baleen whales. Above the waves storm petrels follow ships in fluttering flight,pattering the waves in search of food.
